Sentencas: The influence of rare earth ions on layered perovskite (AA'B2O5+& delta;) is the key to the development of highly active layered perovskite cathode.
Titulo: Exploring the influence of rare earth ions at A-site on the properties of LnBaCo2O5+δ cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein, we make a systematic explanation through experiment and first-principles calculation.
Titulo: Exploring the influence of rare earth ions at A-site on the properties of LnBaCo2O5+δ cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The lattice constant decreases with the decrease of Ln3+ ionic radius, resulting in a smaller space of interstitial oxygen position and increasing oxygen Frenkel energy.
Titulo: Exploring the influence of rare earth ions at A-site on the properties of LnBaCo2O5+δ cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrochemical activity of LnBaCo2O5+& delta; (Ln = Pr, Nd and Sm) electrodes decreases with the decrease of Ln3+ ionic radius, which is mainly attributed to a lower oxygen Frenkel energy.
Titulo: Exploring the influence of rare earth ions at A-site on the properties of LnBaCo2O5+δ cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectra tests show that there are significant differences in the surface exchange process of oxygen because of different surface oxygen vacancy concentration for LnBaCo2O5+& delta;.
Titulo: Exploring the influence of rare earth ions at A-site on the properties of LnBaCo2O5+δ cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For Ln = Pr, Nd, and Sm cathodes, the maximum power densities of the anodesupported Ni-YSZ/YSZ/GDC/LnBaCo2O5+& delta; single cells reach 1.48, 1.36 and 1.06 W/cm2 at 800 degrees C, respectively, indicating that PrBaCo2O5+& delta; with the maximum rare earth ion radius exhibits better oxygen reduction reaction.
Titulo: Exploring the influence of rare earth ions at A-site on the properties of LnBaCo2O5+δ cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These findings provide guidance for the design and fabrication of highly active layered perovskite electrode materials.
Titulo: Exploring the influence of rare earth ions at A-site on the properties of LnBaCo2O5+δ cathode for solid oxide fuel cells
